Posted By: DonRoyale (4/28/2010 11:11:11 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The Eldrazi are certainly very powerful. Just remember, "powerful" is not the same thing as "good."
  
Let's compare Kozilek to our go-to powerhouse card, [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel). Kozilek seems better, right? Because for 10 mana, your getting 12/12; better than 5 for 5/5, right? Well, not really.
  
Let me tell you a little story about a little thing called Tempo. Back in the old days of Alpha, Timmy Players ran rampant through the game. It was basically:
  
T1: land, go
  
T2: land, go
  
...
  
T6: [force of nature](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=force of nature).
  
But then some genius thought, "Hey! What if I use cheap creatures to kill my opponent before he *gets* to 6 mana?" And thus, tempo was born.
  
Yes, kozilek is powerful. But seriously, between a turn 5 drop that basically wins for you ([baneslayer angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=baneslayer angel)) and a turn 10 drop that basically wins for you (kozilek) which would you prefer?
  
and yes, you can ramp your mana. You can ramp your mana to obscene proportions to play Kozile... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

...
T6: force of nature.
But then some genius thought, "Hey! What if I use cheap creatures to kill my opponent before he gets to 6 mana?" And thus, tempo was born.
Yes, kozilek is powerful. But seriously, between a turn 5 drop that basically wins for you (baneslayer angel) and a turn 10 drop that basically wins for you (kozilek) which would you prefer?
and yes, you can ramp your mana. You can ramp your mana to obscene proportions to play Kozile... (see all)

Posted By: Gilder_Bairn (5/16/2010 8:00:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
*"Where is your trickster god now, pathetic mortals? ME."
  
-Kozilek, Butcher of Truth*   
Kozilek is seemingly the middlest of the Eldrazi triad, but in fact he may just be the weakest. Think about it: Kozilek may grant you automatic card advantage, wipe the board clean, and lay waste to the enemy blockers, but take a look at his seemingly weaker brother, [Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre): Akroma-slayer, hardier than Kozilek due to being much closer to a certain Colossus than his bro, and has a bigger and better Brood Lineage to boot. While Kozilek is better at the head of a generic Eldrazi or Colorless deck, Ulamog can have his own deidcated decks. Kozilek may have [It That Betrays](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=It That Betrays), but Ulamog controls many more eminent Eldrazi.

"Where is your trickster god now, pathetic mortals? ME."

While Kozilek is better at the head of a generic Eldrazi or Colorless deck, Ulamog can have his own deidcated decks. Kozilek may have It That Betrays, but Ulamog controls many more eminent Eldrazi.

posts.post_content:
Behold! the eldrazi! The begining of the end for... Mtg...  
  
Yes this is a rant but it has depth  
  
Seriously, I absolutly hate the eldrazi.   
People often complain about baneslayer being OP yet somehow this is brilliant!?  
At least baneslayer doesn't have annihalator.  
What's more OP? 5 mana 5/5 with flying and other goodies ( yes it is OP)  
or a 10 mana 12/12 w/ uncounterable trigger, deck milling killer, and annihilator?  
Not only that but all the eldrazi have are colorless mana. What if baneslayer was colorless too?  
Not to mention that the eldrazi also have countless mana rampers specifically to get them out.  
There is NO strategy in most eldrazi decks but "I Wanna my big guy and he got good boom-boom too"  
again, imagine an eldrazi baneslayer, throw in colorless and annihilator 1 at least, and just for fun a crap-load of cars that say get baneslayer & pals out several turns sooner. And don't forget it'll have a power of at least 7 but let's leave it at 5 because of the goodies it already ha... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: RafiqTheMiststalker (5/11/2010 3:33:16 AM)

posts.post_content: I flip-flopped on this guy--he's the easiest to cast through conventional means, but otherwise, it might be worth it to fork over the extra for pro-colored or indestructible. I know all these people are saying the 4 cards make it worth it, but I don't know what world one might live in where 4 cards (with a net gain of 3) is good for 10 mana, in the likely even that he'll be hit by removal. If you're not running him in blue, fork over the extra mana for the shields.

Posted By: spectermonger (5/10/2010 6:54:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Not only are his power and toughness well set for the mana cost, but his three abilities are incredible. You have the 4 card draw, and then the Annihilator 4. What really sells me is the effect all three legendary Eldrazi have, to shuffle the entire graveyard into the library - which is a life saver in so many ways, and on him you are more likely to collect upon this than the other two (which are both near indestructible).
  
   
I am rating this a 5/5, because it is definitely worth it.
